titles.title: To amend titles XIX and XXI of the Social Security Act to permit States to expand coverage for children between 19 and 25 years of age under Medicaid and under the State child health insurance program (SCHIP).

To amend titles XIX and XXI of the Social Security Act to permit States to expand coverage for children between 19 and 25 years of age under Medicaid and under the State child health insurance program (SCHIP).

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

term.name: Federal aid to child health services

bill.summary: Amends titles XIX (Medicaid) and XXI (State Children's Health Insurance) (SCHIP) to permit states to expand coverage for children between 18 and 25 years of age.
